definition: empty nest/a home where the kids have grown up and moved out

sentences.english: I'm already feeling like an empty nester.
sentences.chinese: 我就已經覺得自己像一個空巢族了。
你將進入空巢家庭狀態。

sentences.english: Objective:To investigate health state and community nursing demands of empty nest elderly in Yinchuan city.
sentences.chinese: 調查銀川市空巢老人的健康狀況及社區護理需求。

sentences.english: The elderly in empty nest family is the group who have special need.
sentences.chinese: 空巢家庭老人是老年人中有獨特需要的羣體。

sentences.english: My son will be gone for college this year ( I will be an empty nester).
sentences.chinese: 幾年我兒子將去上大學，我將成爲空巢老人。

sentences.english: Soon, it will become only me and my wife again, the "empty nest" returns to normal.
sentences.chinese: 不久，又將只有妻和我獨守，“空巢”也將歸於常態。

sentences.english: By these activities, empty-nesters can eliminate of loneliness and realize their own values.
sentences.chinese: 通過這些活動，空巢老人能消除孤獨和實現自身價值。

sentences.english: Presently they were in possession of Pannonia, the empty nest of the Vandals .
sentences.chinese: 他們很快控制了潘諾尼亞，汪達爾人的空巢。

sentences.english: Now these parents are living alone without children in their empty nest . They have become empty nesters .
sentences.chinese: 父母們卻留在空巢裏，他們就成了空巢人啦。

sentences.english: Now these parents are living alone without children in their empty nest . They have become empty nesters .
sentences.chinese: 父母們卻留在空巢裏，他們就成了空巢人啦。

sentences.english: The nest's empty loneliness is almost unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 空巢孤獨感幾乎是令人無法忍受的。

sentences.english: As a result, the number of empty-nest elderly is rising.
sentences.chinese: 結果空巢老人數量上升。

sentences.english: Empirical Study About Urban Elderly of "Empty Nest" and Their Loneliness;
sentences.chinese: 目的瞭解城鎮空巢家庭老年人的社會支持狀況。

sentences.english: From the beam of an empty room your nest will fall.
sentences.chinese: 卻不道人去梁空巢也傾。

sentences.english: At the same time, China's empty nest is also a growing number of elderly people.
sentences.chinese: 同時，自己國空巢白叟地數目也在日益增加。

definition: a family bereaved of its only child
to live alone/to live a solitary existence
"left-behind children", rural children whose parents have to make a living as migrant workers in distant urban areas, but cannot afford to keep the family with them
solitary old man or woman/regular patron (at brothels)
home of respect for aged/nursing home
old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
young people in their late 20s or older who are still unmarried
